text: [music playing]

- Esteban, we're standing
outside your-- well,
your brand-new home.
What do you think of it so far?

ESTEBAN GUTIERREZ:
I'm very, very happy.

And very excited to drive
and to get to know my cars.

Because we have two cars,
something I never have before.

It is-- that is one of the
many new, wonderful things
about Formula E.

- I mean, you're kind of thrown
in at the deep end, aren't you?

I mean, you haven't
really had a huge amount
of experience in the car.

I think that you've just
literally experience
it during the demonstration.

ESTEBAN GUTIERREZ: It's
quite the challenge.

Especially when it's
half of the season.

A lot of drivers have done
with three seasons of Formula E
so far.
Still, anything is possible.

It doesn't mean I won't push,
I will push to the maximum.

And I will try to do my best
to give Mexico a good result.

- Gutierrez's racing pedigree
includes 59 Formula 1 races,

where he started
driving for Team Sauber,

and then, most
recently, for Team Haas.

Now he'll be driving
alongside fellow Formula 1
alumnus, Jean-Eric Vergne.

Why did you think that
Formula E would be
a good choice after Formula 1?

ESTEBAN GUTIERREZ:
The whole the world
is shifting to electric cars.

And I am convinced that the next
two or three years, Formula E

will be one of
the most important
series in motor sports.
- Wow, really?

And do you drive
an electric car?

ESTEBAN GUTIERREZ: Yes.
- Do you?
ESTEBAN GUTIERREZ: Yeah.
- Oh, awesome.
What do you drive?

ESTEBAN GUTIERREZ: Honestly,
I was driving a Tesla.
- Ah, cool.

I wasn't expecting
that for an answer.
That's wicked.

Well, Esteban,
brilliant to meet you.
Welcome to the Formula E family.

And good luck practicing
those seat belt changes.

Because you don't
want to get stuck.

It's amazing how many drivers
have lost races over problems
during that change of car.
